required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Effects of Botox on the Brain Using MRS and fMRI
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring the Functional Effects of Botox on the Brain Using MR Spectroscopy and fMRI

brief_summary.textblock: The injection of BOTOX into peripheral muscles has been shown to have therapeutic effects in a growing number of indications including disorders involving skeletal muscle (e.g., strabismus, blepharospasm, cervical dystonia, spasticity, cosmetic), smooth muscle (e.g., bladder), glands (axillary hyperhidrosis) and nociceptive pain (e.g. migraine) (Brin. 2014). Recently, several studies have suggested that peripheral BOTOX injections in the region of the glabellar lines (muscles around the eyes) may be effective in treating major depression and chronic migraine. However, the mechanism underlying the effect of peripheral BOTOX injections on the brain is not well understood. Therefore, the Investigators propose to further explore the functional effects of BOTOX injections on brain in healthy controls. The approach will involve the measurement of brain metabolites in the brainstem using MRS as well as an investigation of the functioning and connectivity between regions of the brain using resting state MRI and high resolution fMRI.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will receive one MRI scan session prior to a standardized, clinical dose of BOTOX injected into the forehead per FDA-approved procedures. Participants will then undergo a second MRI scan session 2-3 weeks later, after the BOTOX has taken maximal effect. Examining fMRI of the brainstem and the functional connectivity of the brainstem and connections to cortex, may provide additional insight into the effects of BOTOX on neurologic and psychiatric disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Glutamate + Glutamine (Glx)/Creatine Ratio as Measured by MRS in the Brainstem Pre and Post-Botox
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15-33 days between pre and post-Botox scans
primary_outcome.description: Determine whether there are metabolic differences in the brain stem in healthy individuals as a result of BOTOX using MRS. Participants were scanned 1-13 days prior to Botox injections in the glabellar region and then again 14-21 days post-injection when the Botox had reached effectiveness. Metabolite FIDs were averaged within each task and processed using TARQUIN (v.4.3.6) software for spectral fitting. The acquired MRS spectra was corrected for tissue type and T2 relaxation differences. Using TARQUIN we obtained values for Glutamate + Glutamine (Glx), normalized by Creatine.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Functional MRI Mean Blood Oxygen Level Dependent (BOLD) Response in the Amygdala
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15-33 days between pre and post-Botox scans
primary_outcome.description: Understand the effect of BOTOX on functional activity (measured using fMRI) in the brain. Participants were scanned 1-13 days prior to Botox injections in the glabellar region and then again 14-21 days post-injection when the Botox had reached effectiveness. Participants viewed Happy and Angry faces and rated each one as pleasant or unpleasant. We then masked activity in the amygdala to investigate the difference in BOLD response for collapsed across emotion following Botox injections.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Structural Brain Volume Change Following Botox Injections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-33 days between pre and post-Botox scans
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were scanned 1-13 days prior to Botox injections in the glabellar region and then again 14-21 days post-injection when the Botox had reached effectiveness. Structural scans for each participant were segmented using Freesurfer's automatic software for volumetric measures and then normalized by dividing by total intracranial volume for each participant. We then conducted t-tests for pre- vs. post- BOTOX injections to investigate any structural changes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: MRI Scans Pre and Post-Botox Injection
arm_group.description: Participants will receive MRI scans pre and post-Botox injection, including magnetic resonance spectroscopy, structural, and functional MRI.

intervention.description: This study is a pre- and post-design. One scan will be collected prior to BOTOX injection and the second will be collected 14-21 days post-injection. BOTOX injections will be limited to 20 units in the glabellar area, as approved by the FDA .
intervention.arm_group_label: MRI Scans Pre and Post-Botox Injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females
- Ages 30-40 years of age
- Right-handed
- Normal or corrected-to-normal vision
- No history of psychiatric, neurological, or medical co-morbidities that might interfere with normal brain functioning
- Fluent in English
- Moderate to severe glabellar lines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Ferrous metal, a pacemaker, or other battery-operated device implanted in the body
- Claustrophobia
- Known hypersensitivity to Botulinum Toxin
- Infection on the forehead or between the eyes
- Urinary tract infection

group.title: MRI Scans Pre and Post-Botox Injections
group.description: Participants will receive MRI scans pre and post-Botox injection onabotulinumtoxinA: This study is a pre- and post-design. One scan will be collected prior to BOTOX injection and the second will be collected 14-21 days post-injection. BOTOX injections will be limited to 20 units in the glabellar area, as approved by the FDA .

group.description: Participants will receive MRI scans pre and post-Botox injection onabotulinumtoxinA: This study is a pre- and post-design. BOTOX injections will be limited to 20 units in the glabellar area, as approved by the FDA .

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: MRS measures of Glx normalized to Creatine
BOLD fMRI activity in Left Amygdala: Happy faces vs baselines task
BOLD fMRI activity in Left Amygdala: Angry faces vs baselines task

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
